Description: Dish. Central 2-pronged cypress and symmetrical florist's flowers rising from cloud clip and leafy tuft.Rim with lappets of prunus. Made of black, turquoise, red (bole), cobalt painted and glazed ceramic, pottery.
Bibliographic references: Lane 1957 / Later Islamic Pottery: Persia, Syria, Egypt, Turkey (fig.42.B)
Godman 1901 / The Godman collection of Oriental and Spanish pottery and glass, 1865-1900 (71)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2015 – 2016 4 Dec – 29 May, National Museum of Singapore, ‘Treasures of the World’s Cultures’ 2012-2013 Nov-Feb, Kunsthalle, Bonn, 'Treasures of the World's Cultures' 2012 April-August, Abu Dhabi, Manarat Al Saadiyat, 'Treasures of the World’s Cultures' 2023 27 May- 24 Sept, Horsham, Horsham Museum Art Gallery, Frederick Du Cane Godman
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Frederick Du Cane Godman
